text: Quick question for those of you with clients that have multiple portals; Obviously we in agencies have a shared "accounts" view, but do clients using the same email for multiple HS portals get the same functionality?
<@U26BLKGE4> yes they do!
awesome, thanks Pete!
Yes I’m pretty sure it’s the same thing

Maybe i missed something... But has HubSpot made some changes with CTA ?
because all styles for CTA added just after <head> come with !important so it’s impossible to have action on it

So i've ran into this a few times, but the rich text wysiwyg (when using grammarly as a plugin) sometimes injects the grammarly code into the editor. If you view source, sometimes you'll see `<g class="g">sadlkj dasjkds </g>` tags around things. Makes it a little hard to do things in view source and sometimes messes with text

Hi AJ, this is a common thing as it happens in WordPress too. Unfortunately, there's not much you can do other than resolve the grammar issues or switch the Grammarly extension off. Each of these will remove the <g> tags
are you setting the cta to "no style/nolink"
no it’s a simple CTA
so that is why it is forcing that stuff
but I always used this kind of CTA on this website but I never seen !important on style :disappointed: but maybe I’m wrong
PS : it was a pleasure to meet you at the Partner Day :slightly_smiling_face:
if you change to no link/style then it won't have that in there and you can style on your own. Usually what we do is add two classes like btn btn-blue and then style that
you may be able to add a class to those and be able to do something like
a.cta_button.btn.blue { transisition: whatever!important; }
I'm not sure why they are !importaing that
I really hate them using any sort of important
yeah, so good to meet you too!

Hi folks..not sure where to stick this question, so let's try general! :smiley: We are finalizing the Shopify integration...and this part isn't even totally HubSpot, but again, shot in the dark... has anyone been able to set up the Shopify Payment Gateway with an already existing Stripe account? Trying to see if it's possible.

_I know I’ve asked a few times related questions, just trying to think my way out of a problem._ I have pages on a HS site that a user signs into with a username and password(not HS password protected pages, this is a custom thing). Once signed in the user gets sent to a different page, that checks if they’re authenticated, If not authenticated it displays a “403 forbidden” message, redirects them to the login page. If authenticated it shows a normal page template basically with a flex column.

*Has anyone done something similar to what I’m doing?*

Hi! I have an question about HubSpot and Events. Do anyone of you created something like “The Event Calendar”, <https://theeventscalendar.com/product/wordpress-events-calendar-pro/> ? A client want to add events and when the event is over, that must be automatically removed. Or do you have an other good tips for me?
Hey Linda, I think most of us would opt for a HubDB solution for this use-case. Populating a table of events, then on the template loop through the events that will occur in the future.
This happens to me ALL THE TIME and it's so frustrating, and you can turn off Grammerly in certain pages/domains, but then obviously you lose the spell check functionality completely.
Ok, do you have examples? I havent work with HubDB before, but I don’t think it is so hard for me to learn that.

HubDB documentation is here:
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/hubdb>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/get_table_rows>
You'd make a table with date/name/whatever other columns you want, then you can query the table by comparing the date column to the `local_dt` variable.
Then to make the actual calendar display you probably want a JS calendar framework. I like CLNDR: <https://kylestetz.github.io/CLNDR/>
Thank you :smile:
<@U2691T2Q3> I think has experience in calendars + HubDB?

I made a "global module" that has fields that I want to be able to input, and use that module across other pages (that way the content is the same on all pages) -- When I go into the page to edit the content, it tells me it isn't editable.  Is this something we can't do with global modules in the new design manager?OOOR is there a place that you edit the global content?
Have you tried editing it in the design manager?
Global module content is only editable in the design manager.
I am able to set default content in the design manager, but I'm not able to add items to my loop, correct?
What do you mean by add items to your loop? Like a repeater?
Yeah, I have a repeater in the module

Repeater items work just like any other content in modules. So you can edit/add/remove items as well. The thing with global modules is that they all have global content that can only be edited through the custom module editor in the new design manager. So that’s where you want to make those changes.
Anyone know when a customer accepts cookies, is that logged somewhere in HubSpot? Do we have access this data?
I am able to setup default content in there, but I'm not understanding how to add items to the repeater. Is it possible that I'm just stupid?
I can take a look if you want to DM me a link.
ty, sent
Anyone at all?
I’ve got an IT guy asking me where he can access a log of accepted cookies in HubSpot but to my knowledge that doesn’t exist?
UMMM
I think that is a question for support. I can't remember if I was able to access this as a property when the GDPR first hit
Thanks dude, I haven’t been able to track it down either. Just wondering
You could always load in a different browser, fill out a form for a new contact
Then select no on the cookies and browse through the properties, but I am not sure it is visible
not sure if that will help in getting a way to get the info or not ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
<@U25C6PU56> looks like `{{request.contact.contact.hs_legal_basis}}` looks like the property

Got it. Thanks for looking it over AJ. To your point, it would be great if we had a place to list it out or get access to a log whenever anyone accepts or declines, even when it is not tied to a contact record, as most of these accept/decline events happen prior to a contact record being created.
agreed, would be nice to be able to pull this via api as well
I think there’s a bug when creating new forms and setting the form to “Style form using raw HTML”.. Even though I have that setting set to true,  my form button is being styled
i don’t have that green anywhere in my css
and neither is that white highlight at the top of the button
I also notice that the button flips from  my custom css styles, to HubSpot’s style when loading the page… so something is ‘off’
Hello everyone!!! Does anyone know what´s the Google Chrome extension for HubSpot Cache?  I can´t find it yet. :disappointed:
<#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension> though we really would appreciate it if you let us know when you encounter caches not expiring promptly so we can look into it
Thanks!
you can also check out <#CCQ7H31D5|developer-tools> <@UD5GXJW1M> for more cool tools

Very happy for your help! Have an other question too - what about Event Lists without Calendar - almost like Bloglist, but posts must be automatically removed when the date is passed :smile::innocent: Hope you understand what I mean :blush:
